results.title: A housewife in Seoul
results.creator_credit: You Dang-Kyu, Gian Manara, Lee Kyu-Im, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, KBS Korea and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Kim Nan-Hi is a middle-class housewife in a high rise development on the outskirts of Seoul. This program looks at her daily life, her dedication to her children’s education and the family at work and play together, illustrating the Confucian philosophy that “great happiness has been found in the small pleasures of the family”. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: A House on the prairie
results.creator_credit: Bob Lower, Ron Bashford, Jerry Krepakevich and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The promise of riches in a new land lured many settlers to the West, but it was a harsh climate where shelter was the most urgent necessity. A House on the Prairie describes the legacy of these early days: environmentally unsuitable dwellings that now either devour money and fuel to remain functional, or slowly disintegrate in the sun, wind and frost. People today are beginning to recognize the importance of housing suitable to specific environments, and some of these new examples of western Canadian architecture are presented, with comments by designers, builders, and the people who live in the somewhat experimental dwellings.

results.title: A House divided: caregiver stress and elder abuse
results.creator_credit: Lyn Wright, Silva Basmajian, John Spotton and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Through four moving portraits, A House Divided sheds light on the tragedy of caregiver stress and elder abuse. The abuse takes many forms, ranging from willful neglect and financial exploitation to physical assault. With great sensitivity, this film portrays the emotional complexity of family relationships that can lead to abuse of the elderly, the anguish and isolation of its victims, and the tremendous need for community understanding and support.

results.title: A Horse with stripes
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ross and Andrew O'Sullivan
results.brief_description: Manicured lawns…immaculate houses…clean streets…but beneath this highly desirable exterior lurks the desperation of the bored, the scared, the paranoid and the violent. And when the tranquil suburban life of the Goldings and the Bates deteriorates into chaos, they choose not to speak about it. Winner of Silver Hugo, Best short drama, Chicago International Film Festival, USA, 1991.

results.title: A Horse's world
results.creator_credit: Steve Ruggi, Louise Jones, ITV, Learning Channel and Wall to Wall Television
results.brief_description: The horse is a paradox - a prey animal who lost his independence and submits to man’s enslavement - yet is also a symbol of dignity and freedom. This video looks at man’s most noble friend from an entirely new perspective; that of the horse itself. Innovative camera techniques show the world from a horse-eye-view as new research explains why horses behave like they do, allowing the viewer a greater understanding of horses and their behaviour.

results.title: A Hole in the ground
results.brief_description: A pictorial and sound experiment in which there is virtually no subject movement. All movement is relayed by way of camera and sound track. On a ghost train a ghost of a man comes to town. He makes his way to the hub of that town, the gold mine. Working there, he is killed in a cave-in and remains as one of the town’s permanent residents in the cemetery.

results.title: A Hole in one
results.brief_description: An early animated film about a farmer and his attempts to ride his pet goat. Efforts by the local policeman to ride the goat also fail. The goat finally charges at the farmer and butts him head first into the 18th hole, hence the title of the film
